options.label: D
options.text: Absence of contralateral lower limb proprioception

questions.correct_answer: C. Absence of ipsilateral arm proprioception

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about renal tubular transport?

questions.correct_answer: D. Amino acid is reabsorbed in proximal tubule

A 35-year-old male presents to a psychiatrist with a history of recurrent and persistent sexual fantasies and behaviors. He reports a strong and recurrent urge to touch or rub his genitals against non-consenting strangers in crowded places such as buses or subway trains. A 28-year-old male presents to the clinic after jamming his finger while playing basketball. He is unable to fully extend his left index finger at the distal interphalangeal (DIP) joint. On examination, there is tenderness over the dorsal aspect of the DIP joint and the finger is held in a flexed position. X-ray imaging shows no evidence of bony injury. What is the most likely anatomical structure involved in this injury?

options.label: A
options.text: Terminal slip of extensor tendon to distal phalanx

options.label: B
options.text: Terminal slip of flexor tendon to distal phalanx

options.label: C
options.text: Terminal slip of flexor tendon to proximal phalanx

options.label: D
options.text: Terminal slip of extensor tendon to proximal phalanx

questions.correct_answer: A. Terminal slip of extensor tendon to distal phalanx

questions.text: General fertility rate is a better measure of fertility in defining GFR , which of the following is taken as the denominator?

options.label: B
options.text: Mid year women population between 15 to 49 years of age in the same year

options.label: C
options.text: Mid year married women between 15 to 49 years of age in the same year of age

questions.correct_answer: B. Mid year women population between 15 to 49 years of age in the same year

A 22-year-old woman complains of palpitations and has a regular heartbeat at a rate of 170/min, with a blood pressure of 110/70 mm Hg. The rate abruptly changes to 75/min after applying carotid sinus pressure. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old man develops shortness of breath (SOB) and chest pain 7 days after an open cholecystectomy. His blood pressure is 145/86 mm Hg, pulse is 120/min, respirations 24/min, and oxygen saturation of 97%. Pulmonary embolism is clinically suspected. Which of the following is the most specific ECG finding of pulmonary embolism?

options.label: A
options.text: A deep S wave in lead I

options.label: B
options.text: Depressed ST segments in leads I and II

options.label: C
options.text: Prominent Q wave in lead I, and inversion of T wave in lead III

questions.correct_answer: C. Prominent Q wave in lead I, and inversion of T wave in lead III

questions.text: A 56-year-old man presents with SOB, fatigue, and edema. He has also noticed weight gain, abdominal discomfort, and distension. He has a prior history of lung cancer treated with radiotherapy to the chest. There is no history of liver or cardiac disease in the past. On examination, he has an elvated JVP, prominent y descent of neck veins, and positive Kussmaul’s sign. The heart sounds are normal. The CXR shows a normal cardiac silhouette and the ECG has low voltages. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old woman with diabetes presents with lesions on her leg. They are not painful and have a central depression and raised irregular margin. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

An 18-year-old woman was diagnosed 7 years earlier with precocious pseudopuberty secondary to ovarian tumor. Physical examination reveals oral and lingual dark pigmentation. Which of the following is false?

options.label: C
options.text: Increased risk of breast & pancreatic cancer

questions.text: A 53-year-old man presents with diarrhea. He also complains of facial flushing lasting minutes at a time. Physical examination reveals facial telangiectasias and a heart murmur not present 2 years before. This murmur is accentuated by deep breathing. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial diagnostic test?

A 57-year-old man, recently discharged from the hospital, develops severe diarrhea and abdominal pain. Sigmoidoscopy reveals a granular friable mucosa. Which of the following is the most common cause of this syndrome?

A 19-year-old man has a long history of weight loss, abdominal distention, bloating, and diarrhea. Investigation reveals steatorrhea, and a small bowel biopsy reveals blunting and flattening of villi. Which of the following is not associated with the condition?

options.text: Tissue transglutaminase IgA is highly sensitive & specific

questions.text: A 34-year-old man is seen for asymptomatic elevations in his AST and ALT. He appears well and the physical examination is normal. There is no prior history of intravenous drug use, blood transfusions, or multiple sex partners. His hepatitis serology is positive for the virus, most likely to lead to chronic infection. Which of the following is most likely etiology?
A patient is diagnosed with acute promyelocytic leukemia (AML-M3). Which of the following is a characteristic of this acute myelogenous leukemia?
questions.correct_answer: D. Auer bodies in blast cells

questions.text: A 63-year-old man developed a transient episode of vertigo, slurred speech, diplopia, and paresthesias. He is symptom-free now, and clinical examination is entirely normal. His past medical history is significant for hypertension and dyslipidemia. Which of the following is the most likely cause for symptoms?
questions.correct_answer: A. Posterior circulation transient ischemic attack (TIA)

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman complains of episodes of severe unilateral, stabbing facial pain that is intermittent for several hours, and then disappears for several days. Physical examination is entirely normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy has multiple tan-colored patches on his skin, and freckle-like skin changes in his armpit area. The rest of clinical examination is normal. Which of the following conditions is also found in patients with this disorder as they get older?
questions.correct_answer: C. Multiple cutaneous and subcutaneous tumors
